website_summaries.verdict: For those who prefer wood over plastic, this is the push walker for you.
pros: Beautifully crafted with bright colors and full alligator action
It's quiet despite the alligator chomping, which most parents appreciate
Extra weight keeps it from tipping over
cons: Provides good stability while walking but not designed as a pull to stand aid
Handle paint has been known to chip

website_summaries.verdict: A multi-tasking push toy that doubles as a walker for tots ages 12 months and up. A variety of fun features keep babies engaged as they work on coordination and motor skills.
pros: Sturdy construction offers enough support to help little ones gain walking confidence without doing all the work for them
Adorable alligators reward each step with a satisfying "clack."
Chunky spinning beads improve fine motor skills
Non-skid wheels are safe for hardwood floors
cons: Younger babies who rely on a good deal of leverage to pull themselves up may tip it over

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Baby was 8 months when I first ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Baby was 8 months when I first bought it. He was just starting to stand and trying to walk. He liked the car but didn't really push it. It will move when they try to use it to stand up. We never let him use it unsupervised. I had to hold the front because it would not hold him. Now that he has more balance, he'll push it. I wouldn't recommend it for babies who are just starting to stand and walk without close supervision. It moves too fast for beginners on wood and tile floor. We used it on carpet and grass first.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Romero

customer_reviews.title: Works well for multiple stages
customer_reviews.text: My little one started using this around 6 months old so we added some extra "wings" for stability. Otherwise it would tip when she pulled herself up. Now she is 11 months and confidently walking without any assistance but still has fun pushing the cart and stacking stuffed animals on the front for a ride. The wings had to be removed too. In the picture she's 9 months old and very short for her age. This cart moves well on all floors in our house. The rubber on the wheels prevents major slipping on hardwood floors and it still moves well on thick and thin carpet.
customer_reviews.author: ab

customer_reviews.title: Adorable walker for babies!
customer_reviews.text: Melissa and Doug does it again! I ordered this for my cousin’s first birthday, and it was a hit! He’s pulling himself up, but he’s not walking, alone, but with this toy, he zips around !! The alligators that move their mouths, in the front, are so cute! Melissa and Doug are my go to for any child’s toy!! I would highly recommend for any gift, or for your little one.
customer_reviews.author: Felici

customer_reviews.title: First one defective, second one became a safety hazard!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I ordered this when it arrived it appeared to be used already and the wheels were jammed. I returned it and then the new one I received seemed fine for about a week, then yesterday my baby was playing with it and I noticed the wood splintering off the sides! The quality is terrible and this is not a safe toy for a child. I expected so much more from a Melissa and Doug product! We were faithful customers of this brand until this mishap. I don’t recommend this toy to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Bi Y.

customer_reviews.title: Adorable-recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: Our son’s walking journey was not fast and off to the races, he needed encouragement and some help. He started taking independent steps around 14 months and it took a couple of weeks for more confident steps. The toy does not make a sound, the little alligators just open and close quietly as it rolls. There’s felt in their mouths that keeps them from “clacking”. The BEST this about this Walker is that it’s so vase-heavy that he really could lean his weight into it earlier on and it would never tip over. Absolutely never did. Very cute!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie D

customer_reviews.title: Simple beautiful walking toy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 14 month old godson. He loves it! One of the screws does not fit the hole properly, but I was able to make do. Seems like there is inconsistency in the parts from the review I read and what I received that can be easily resolved. From what I recall, the box did say for children 12 months and older. This toy is not for kids who cannot balance and free stand. I believe it’s because the toy moves without much effort. Beautiful design with the right elements. Also easy to store because it’s so small.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Ward

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves this. Unpacking was a different story
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loved this and it came as described. It was very sturdy and I love that it was wooden and built from quality rather than plastic. The only downside was the foam packing it was placed in from shipping had gotten stuck on the wheels and had a very sticky imprint on the wheels. I had to scrub it off and it wasn't a quick and easy task. So apart from that it has been a great addition to my child's learning to walk experience.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little walker and my baby loves it too. Bought it when he was 8 months old and it still continues to interest him. The wheels will fly on smooth tile unless baby is coordinated enough not to put all the weight on it sending it zooming so at first we had it on thin carpet which provided a nice slow pace for him then moved it to the tile. We have taken this to farmers' markets where he zooms all over the asphalt parking lot. It does horrible in gravel. Very well made, colorful, and cute. We receive lots of compliments every time we use it. The crocs are not annoying at all for adults. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Laura Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Pre-drilled holes misaligned = product fail
customer_reviews.text: One of the two pre-drilled holes for screwing the handle to the body of it was not aligned right, so there's no way we can screw in the handle. Super frustrating - glad we had other gifts for our toddler Christmas morning :(
customer_reviews.author: BeOne5

customer_reviews.title: Kids love this toy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy for my grandson when he was one and he loves it! He laughed at the chomping sounds of the alligators and loved to touch them. Two years later he still laughs as he zooms around the house, pushing the toy and the alligators are chomping away. He loves it so much I bought one for another grandson. My daughter says it is one of his favorite toys.
customer_reviews.author: MKN

customer_reviews.title: Too fast
customer_reviews.text: We are *those parents* who try to avoid batteries and excessive plastic so we have this a shot. It rolls too quickly. We have to be right there when our kiddo uses it to make her she doesn’t faceplant. She knows it too, so her interest has waned. She does love the clacking alligator mouths. Instead, we ended up with a little walker table (gifted so I don’t have a link) that moved more slowly and she can use on her own.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Gompert

customer_reviews.title: Great wooden walker. Easy to use. Baby loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Love that it is all wood. My daughter loves it. We started using it when she was 11 months. Initially she used it to walk on her knees and rapidly progressed to stand up and walk around with it. As far as I know there is no way of tweaking how fast the wheels move which would be my only complaint but to be fair I am not aware that this is a feature in any other walker. It’s small enough to store easily. Came well packaged. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but poor execution
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but poor execution. Kids loved to play with it for the 1 week it worked. That is until a piece came loose and an alligator no longer worked. The issue is there is a dowel that acts as the rear axle. There are 3 plastic lobes attached the the dowel to make the 3 alligators chomp. These plastic lobes are riveted into the dowel and so one of mine popped loose. I couldn't figure out a way to open the toy up to fix it so I ended up having to return it. This probably wouldn't have been an issue had they used screws instead of rivets into wood.
customer_reviews.author: rly44

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this for my 10 month old and it has been a huge hit! He hasn't started walking yet, but with this toy he can get up and run right across the room. I like the build quality, the alligators have felt in their mouths which helps them to not be too loud. It all seems really well put together, we haven't had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Pawa

customer_reviews.title: Safety issue
customer_reviews.text: Sorry but I can not recommend this because It is very lightweight to push, babies can fall easily
customer_reviews.author: Best mom

customer_reviews.title: we love it
customer_reviews.text: My first impression was that it is much smaller than I imagined it. I got it for my 7 month old son who shows interest in walking, and it's perfect for him at this stage to start practicing. It's recommend for 12+ but I think it depends more on the development of your particular child. By 12 months it may not be as useful to my son, or at least not for long, for example. I'm glad he has it now and am happy with the purchase. It feels well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Roth

customer_reviews.title: Super adorable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: So great, my baby loves this, it doesn’t move too fast and get out of control unlike others I’ve tried. He walks back and forth with it a few times. He also plays with the little butterflies on the back. He even pulls himself up on it sometimes to start walking without my help and it doesn’t flip. I bought this after he used the same thing at a friends house.
customer_reviews.author: Cdubs

customer_reviews.title: The perfect toy for a 1-year-old!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this pusher as a present for baby's 1st birthday because his favorite thing was pushing our dining room chairs around the room (really). He took to this gator pusher so fast that I felt like .Mom of the Year - he's obsessed with this toy! It's cute, well constructed, and the kiddo loves it. What else is there to say? 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: P & A Woods

customer_reviews.title: Well made, sturdy, won't tip over
customer_reviews.text: This little 'gator walker is just right for a child beginning to walk. It won't tip over like many plastic ones. This is one you'll be able to pass down or give to another little one when you're toddler is up and running! I also like that it is wood with no garish crap on it, no batteries, no lights, no whistles. Nothing to break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for tile and wood; non-slip
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a durable, sturdy, non-skid walker. My house is all tile no carpet at all. I was worried about him slipping watching friends with the plastic walkers on hard surfaces. The non-slip material kn the wheels works as advertised. It can be frustrating for toddlers as drag turning isn't as easy with this one but, much less worry for parents. There is also safety stop. When the child stands it is designed to tip and lock on the wooden stops so it wont roll away on your child while they get their footing. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Cute and sturdy. HOWEVER, broken...
customer_reviews.text: Cute and sturdy. However, mine arrived with a large 1.5” chip missing which made it sharp and splintery. I returned it and the replacement is estimated to arrive in 4 weeks. Super crazy! My child may be walking on his own by then. Very upsetting. A replacement should be rushed being that I’ve paid and received a dangerous product.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, Not any more sturdier than the plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, Not any more sturdier than the plastic Fisher Price or VTech. I wish I had bought one of those, so that my grand son would have something to do other than walking with it. He loses interest in it quickly. When he loses balance and tries to stand back up with it, it topples over. I had purchased the VTech for my grand daughter, and it did the same thing, but there were activities to keep her interested.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Clifton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Classic Wood
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t tip over or shake. It came in two pieces so the assembly was simple and took one minute. It has a good weight. My 10.5 months old just managed cruising and walked pushing this well. It’s all wood and the design is simply classic. Recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Great but obnoxious
customer_reviews.text: My youngest has finally stopped playing with this thing. It is great to help learn walking skills, but the noise gets old quick. Was one of the favorite toys from the standing up through the mid walking/running phase. It has some weight and doesn't slide around like some of the cheap plastic alternatives. Very impressive and annoying product.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D.

customer_reviews.title: Handle incorrectly aligned
customer_reviews.text: We love this product and so does our baby. The only issue was that the handle wouldn’t align correctly on one side and the screw wouldn’t go in all the way. It sticks out at the bottom but it’s still usable and reasonably sturdy. Just doesn’t look great.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Endless Fun
customer_reviews.text: We love this toy! I purchased it for my daughter when she was 8mo and started pulling up on all of the furniture. It's now 2 1/2mo later and it still provides endless fun for her. We have hardwood floors and she pushes her walker all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: Msnow

customer_reviews.title: Great walker!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful walker! We have a ypewi (also great) but it's wheels are too fast and cause the ypewi to move quickly, which was intimidating to a 9 month old getting the courage to walk. We found this walker, which was adorable--we love the clacking of the alligators--and reasonable priced, she could pull herself up without it sliding and moving too quickly! After a month of practicing, she was walking on her own!! We take it to the park and have met many friends walking around. She still enjoys walking with this and will put toys on it to push along. Happy we found this walker!
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Cute and simple but check for splinters and scratches
customer_reviews.text: I like the simplicity and design. There are interesting focal points for baby even if they’re not strong standers yet. Unfortunately I got a splinter when unboxing which scared me for the babies, so I recommend smoothing over every surface with your hands to address any jagged edges before unleashing to the kids. Also came with the wheel damaged or used? Recommend better QC on the product before packing.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: Was really excited about this item but proved to be way to short for our baby. He is a bit tall but still hoped it would have been good given he was only 13 months. Easy to assemble and looks well made
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Super Cute
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Grandson. It worked great and was entertaining too. I would purchase again. Since it is a walker, keep in mind that it will be used for a short period of time. My Grandson's looks like new after using it for a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Babies 8 - 18 months LOVE this toy/walker
customer_reviews.text: I love this wood walker so much that I bought the exact same one for baby #2, 6 years later! Perfect toy for pre-walkers and new walkers alike. Ages 8-18months seems to be the ages that really LOVE this push toy/walker. Helps baby learn to walk and once they have mastered that, it's still fun to push around and make the alligator chomp. The rubber strips on the wheels help to grip so that pre-walkers don't slip, slide or go too fast over wood or tile floors. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Summer H.

customer_reviews.title: Product is well-made, and my just-beginning-to-walk grandson enjoys pushing ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is well-made, and my just-beginning-to-walk grandson enjoys pushing it; however, I assumed the alligators would make a “clack-clack” sound, and these do not. In fact, they seem to have some sort of material glued onto the gators’ mouths to make sure they do not make any noise.
customer_reviews.author: R. Newell

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is AAMAZING. It is super adorable...we love that each croc's mouth opens at different times. It also so sturdy and heavy. This is great because we have four kids and have often found that these walkers slip out from the child...causing them to fall. BUT with This one being nice and heavy and has rubberized wheels, there is no slipping when using this product on our hardwood floors. Everyone at our son's party responded to this. Great gift or toy and highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Hague

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for wood/laminate floors!
customer_reviews.text: I have a slow to walk baby and wood floors, so none of the walking toys with plastic wheels worked... They'd slide and he'd fall. This was the perfect solution!!! He loves it and it's heavy enough to not fall when he puts all his weight on it to stand. The rubber strip prevents it from sliding and it seems to government his speed. Totally recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Medler

customer_reviews.title: Don’t even think about it.
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a bit more sturdy. And it’s chipped in a couple places after a week or two of having it. Update..... okay, no, Like the little bits that chipped off I was able to see before they came off and could throw it away before my son got to it, so I didn’t think too much about them... but this new big chip, we didn’t see till my son put it in his mouth... I’m so upset. Im throwing it away as I write this...
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Habibi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing, high quality, sturdy, baby walker! Reminds me of when I was a kid when I had a good number of wooden toys. My son LOVES it. He’s 16 months old and not walking yet, but he’s all over the house pushing this around. He’s able to pivot and turn it side to side when running into walls and contraptions. I’m hoping he will walk in no time with the help if this push toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for learning to walk!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased for a grandchild who is ready to learn to walk. The first one was for my now 19 month old grandson and it is still one of his favorite toys to push around even though he has been walking now for months. It is sturdy and doesn't tip over when a little one is just learning to take steps. The one I just bought is for my 7 month old granddaughter for Christmas and I am sure she will love it as well. It is beautiful, colorful and the clacking noise of the alligators chomping is fun but not obnoxious. I highly recommend this toy for anyone with a soon-to-be toddler!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Great first walker!
customer_reviews.text: I love this walker. Bought it for our daughters one year birthday. It’s sturdy and goes slower than the plastic walkers on our hard wood floors which was exactly what I wanted so it didn’t slip out from her
customer_reviews.author: Ashley L. O’Malley

customer_reviews.title: We love this!
customer_reviews.text: We really like this because compared to other walkers- it doesn't slide out in front of our son is he pushes on it. A different one that we had seems to slide out in front of him, causing him to fall forward more often. Since this is built on a 90 degree angle, it does not do that. He also loves how the alligators mouths open and close as he walks!
customer_reviews.author: Tamerruhh

customer_reviews.title: Best beginner walker
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my fourth grandson. My other three grandsons loved it but it wasn’t around when number 4 came around. The mother had loaned it to friends. It is so sturdy, no idea how many children could use the same one and it still would b in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Pfeiffer

customer_reviews.title: Most loved Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my 11 month old grandson who is not yet walking. I told his mom and dad that they would probably want to carry it home unopened because it was a toy for after he begins walking. Well, what a surprise when he took hold and took his first steps with this lovely toy. He loved it so much and immediately began cruising all around the house, with just a little help steering around corners. The wheels are designed to not push too quickly, and the toy is very sturdy. I was very excited to have given him his very favorite Christmas present this year.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Well built all-wood toy
customer_reviews.text: Vibrant colors. Gators are quiet when baby pushes the toy. Came almost assembled just had to attach the handle. Like that this toy will encourage walking and doesn’t have any noisy parts or need batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy B.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and moves at a safe speed
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought this for my 10-month old. The previous walker we had purchased is all plastic and moves too quickly. This walker has more weight to it and also has rubber grips on the wheels. It only moves as fast as my son wants to go and seems much safer. He also really likes playing with the alligators and parts of the handle. Really good quality so I imagine it will hold up well for years, we will be passing along to another lucky baby. Highly recommend spending the money on this one, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!! You'll be glad you did!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best thing I have ever bought for my son. He started standing and trying to walk around 7 months so I wanted to get him a cool walker that wasn't cheap plastic. This thing is excellent quality and I plan to paint his name on the side. It's adorable, durable and not much more money than the cheap plastic ones. I often take it with us when we visit friends or family because it keeps him occupied and everyone loves it!! I only wish it was made in the US, but that is hard to find these days.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina S.

customer_reviews.title: Cute gators
customer_reviews.text: Very cute toy. The chomping gators are adorable. We love that it’s wood, not plastic.
customer_reviews.author: curious

customer_reviews.title: Unable to build
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to build this toy since the holes for the handle were misaligned. I am returning and purchasing the newer version in hopes that it has been fixed. We play with this toy at grandma's house and it is lots of fun, just wish it was able to be assembled properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money. I love having wooden toys over all the cheap plastic. I only wish I would have thought about buying it sooner. I'm sure my daughter would have been walking sooner if she'd had this since she could stand. Love Melissa & Doug products. The alligators on the one we received were not loud at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: unsafe and unadjustable
customer_reviews.text: As a great fan of Melissa and Doug, I am very disappointed. The handle is not adjustable which is a real design flaw. Second, it rolls too fast on wood floors and tile, and even on carpet to the point of being a safety hazard.
customer_reviews.author: bs_meter

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed at the quality
customer_reviews.text: Cute product and felt sturdy. During the first day of my son using it, we noticed there were blue paint wood chips on his playmat. After examining the walker, we noticed a big chip on the side where it came from. Really disappointed at the quality. Glad that we found it before he can ingested it. We had to dispose of the walker just in case anymore comes off. Unfortunately we already threw the box away so we can return it.
customer_reviews.author: CCNYC

customer_reviews.title: Best walker ever
customer_reviews.text: This walker hold a very special place in my heart. Both my kids used it when they were learning to walk and both both it. I have so many fond memories of taking it to the park with them. It's very well made and so much cuter than other ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: Lise

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Wish it were made in the USA.
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic. Very durable. Super cute. It has really been helping my son learn to walk. It is a bit lighter on the bottom than I thought so you need to stay close when baby is learning to walk because it will tip over until they get the hang of it but it is much more durable then all the plastic garbage out there. The only thing I did not love is it is made in China. Says safety standards are US but says nothing about being free of toxins or what kind of paint used.... I am not nuts about baby chewing on it.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Smith

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely adorable! I bought this for my son who turned ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely adorable! I bought this for my son who turned six months old. I love that it's wooden and the base is large enough that if he try's to pull himself up it helps hold the weight and doesn't tumble backwards on him. The color are rich and got his attention right away. The little alligators open and close there mouths when it is pushed and they make a little snap sound! Over all we are very happy with this little push toy!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Bender

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and our little guy loves roaming around with ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and our little guy loves roaming around with it. It is pretty heavy, though, and once your child has the ability to pick it up slightly off the floor you'll need to make sure they don't drop it on their toes. The blue paint also comes off when the toy bangs into walls, doors, etc., so if you have walls you don't want marked with blue paint be forewarned!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Wondeful! Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this walker! Our daughter learned to walk just a week after we gave this to her for Christmas so she didn’t get to use it much. She liked the sound the alligators made when she pushed it. It is made of quality materials and is very stable. She was also gifted a plastic walker from someone else and it tipped over all the time. We will be keeping this alligator one to be passed on to future generations.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Just as described or better.
customer_reviews.text: Just as described or better. We have a nine month old and he's just excited about his new toy. Only two screws to assemble and it's ready.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter used one of these at daycare, so we got one for home. Very easy to assemble, sturdy, and she loves it! Really helped her mobility and walking ... and she continues to use it even though she can now walk on her own.
customer_reviews.author: InTheDale

customer_reviews.title: A Hit With My Pre-Walker
customer_reviews.text: My nine month old's latest trick is to stand up. He stands behind this walker and clumsily works to put one foot in front of the other, always to the chomp and clack of the alligators. He's thrilled at his accomplishment and delighted with the effects. I bought thinking he'd grow into it, thinking it would be used once he'd learned to walk. Rather this toy helps bridge the span between crawling and free-standing walking. Beautifully made of hard wood, this is a toy that should last across generations of walking novices.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Kleinkauf

customer_reviews.title: Cute and Different!
customer_reviews.text: We got this walker for our one year old granddaughter, and she loves it. It is sturdy enough that she can pull herself up on it without it tipping over. It was a little difficult for her to control on hardwood floors, but worked great on carpet. Now that she is walking better, she's fine with it on hardwoods. The chomping mouths are a cute addition, and are not loud. We didn't have any difficulty with assembly or safety, as mentioned in some previous reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Ball

customer_reviews.title: Middle of the road for quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughters first birthday and was surprised to find out how light it was. She couldn’t put her body weight to lift herself up at first on this toy, which was disappointing. Also, during the birthday party a set of two year old girls were paying with both of her push toys and this one actually chipped on one of the edges.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our babies are obsessed with this!!
customer_reviews.text: We already love this walker so much! It works great on our carpet and tile!! It's also not too bulky to take along to Granna's house! The craftsmanship and design is beautiful, it makes me so happy to have a quality toy that I know won't look obnoxious or outdated in 10 years. Absolutely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our then nine month old daughter and she adored it from the beginning. She'd played with a similar toy made of plastic and had a hard time using it because it went too fast and she couldn't keep up with it. This one is perfect for babies who are just getting the confidence to stand and walk with assistance. At eleven months old she is about to start walking on her own, and still loves this toy. She can now really PUSH it, and the fact that it doesn't speed off is fantastic. She also likes to pet the alligators and spin the wooden beads. The best version of this sort of toy I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Babies, Dogs, and Books

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Easy to put together!
customer_reviews.text: I was really worried about this on my wood floors but it hasn't hurt them at all and isn't even very loud! It has some sort of rubber strip that helps. Both of my 13 month olds love this! One is already walking but loves it anyway. It also seems easier to steer than their plastic one that also has an obnoxious song that plays on repeat!
customer_reviews.author: Raegan Conlin

customer_reviews.title: My 9 month old loves this!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little push-toy for babies learning to walk. The wheels have just the right amount of resistance.... my 9-month old can push, but not so easily that the whole cart goes flying out from under him. Don't get me wrong, we had a couple spills before he got the hang of it... but I couldn't ask for more in a learning toy.
customer_reviews.author: DeweyDellTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Should the alligators make a clacking sound
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this alligator walker for my Grandson’s first birthday. The only thing is it don’t make any noise when pushed. I thought the alligator made a clacking sound when pushed. There was felt under alligator’s jaws. So that prevented any noise except for wheels going around. I saw this in someone else’s house & it did make a clacking sound when heads went up & down. A little disappointed with the product.
customer_reviews.author: linda silverberg

customer_reviews.title: Even better in person (the movement of the alligators!)
customer_reviews.text: This walker is SO cute! I saw it at a friend's house, but my daughter has been walking for almost a year now. I bought this as a first birthday gift for a little fella this past weekend who isn't walking yet. The movement of the alligators is absolutely adorable. I love Melissa & Doug products and, in particular, their wooden toys. It is a very entertaining walker. I will definitely get one for my next child!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Lynn

customer_reviews.title: and it's his favorite toy. He is really cruising with it now
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a walking toy for my 10 month old grandson who just started to pull himself up and learning how to walk with assistance. He has had it for about two months, used it immediately, and it's his favorite toy. He is really cruising with it now, almost 11 months old. It does require some supervision. The toy is very study and well built. He absolutely loves it. Would buy it again, and really appreciate all the reviews that were posted - they were a big driver for buying it.
customer_reviews.author: gabememe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy for "pre-walker"
customer_reviews.text: For those little ones who just can't wait to walk,this stable, colorful push toy is perfect. Our grandson was trying to walk from six months and I wish we'd had this for him then. Even now that he's walking on his own, he enjoys pushing it around. It's colorful and well made. The only drawback is that it doesn't turn, not unlike all other similar toys, so he gets really frustrated when he comes to the end of a straight run! We have to be there to turn it for him. I'd recommend it for six to eighteen months.
customer_reviews.author: lbilady

customer_reviews.title: So stinkin' cute!
customer_reviews.text: We both this for our 10 month old for Christmas and she's been using it as a walker as well as playing with it for the past 3 months. She actually picks up our dog's stuffed toys and places them on top of the gators and then pushes the toy around the house. We love this walker because it has the rubber tread around the tires which keeps the wheels from sliding on the hardwood floors (someone bought us a plastic lion one and it slides every which way on the floors). Furthermore, this toy is just so cute!
customer_reviews.author: BCJ

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Very cute sturdy push toy but every time my grandson pulled the toy toward him to turn it around, it would hit his toes and feet and hurt him. The toy needs to be redesigned so there is no injury to the toddler. I returned the toy for a refund. Too bad because I’ve always liked Melissa and Doug toys.
customer_reviews.author: mkteach

customer_reviews.title: Quality Wood Toy
customer_reviews.text: If my review is helpful, please click that it was! Does what it say. My little nephew seemed to enjoy his. It was shipped straight to my brother's home, so I can't speak to packaging and what not, but when I saw it in person I was impressed with durability and appearance. The click clack seemed to keep my nephew interested as well. Seemed to be a good toy for the early walking stage as it almost doubles as a walker. I'd recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: The Analytical Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Well made, little heavy, the handle does not move to adjust for the kid...
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: This was perfect for our 11 month old
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter went from cruising around our furniture to cruising with 'her alligators' to walking like a pro over a 3 week span. My only complaint is the clearance is quite small and we have blue paint on some of the transition strips at our house. We also have blue paint on lots of the trim pieces at the bases of our walls. We have kids and don't expect our house to remain pristine, so this is still 5 stars due to the joy it's brought our daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Bob R.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful developmental toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a wonderful developmental toy! At first our son wasn’t too sure about it, but he eventually figured out how to use it and goes for it multiple times a day! He loves it! It’s a beautiful toy, great as a gift or for your own baby!
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves walking it around the house! And it’s simple enough that it doesn’t totally distract her. Awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie P.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This walker is super cute and my son immediately loved it! Unfortunately we’ve had it about 3 days and the wood around the wheel is splintering and chipping. I’m going to try to sand it down so my son can safely use it. It’s just disappointing for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SB10

customer_reviews.title: Great Baby First Walker
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my first son and I like to so much I bought one for my brother's first son. Very good wooden construction. Easy for baby to learn to walk. The walker does not roll to fast (It moves with the pace of the child). One down side the alligator chompers have caught my son's leg before (only happened once). High price, but it has lasted 5 children and still works like new!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Subudhi

customer_reviews.title: my son doesn't really enjoy toys like that
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. I really look hard to find him a push cart toy that didn't have lights and crazy sound affects. 1. my son doesn't really enjoy toys like that. 2. As his parent I also do not like toys that have a sound system. It does roll very easily on our wood floors. I just have to make sure I am with him so he doesn't lose his footing with it. We usually have him play with it on the carpet. I would recommend this to anyone. It gets 5 stars for its cute design, ease of use and it doesn't have any annoying sound affects like most kids toys these days.
customer_reviews.author: Allison D.

customer_reviews.title: My kid loves it
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves this toy. The gators on the toy do chomp as she pushes it around. Very cute.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: perfect one year old gift
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is turning one in a week and is obsessed with this toy. She never crawled and, like most kids who are experiencing the thrill of walking, prefers to have her hands held high while being walked around. Gone are the days of carrying her. She loves this toy - if we walk by it she will not move forward and will turn her body until we walk toward it. Her ability to stand alone is not there yet, so we have to make sure we are holding her shirt to make sure that she doesn't lurch forward too quickly/fall down. I will be buying this for all one year olds i know.
customer_reviews.author: Vohnson

customer_reviews.title: Just buy the fun plastic push toy
customer_reviews.text: For about three months my child was terrified of this toy. She had another push toy that she loved, but the alligators really scared her. Now she's ok with it, but it's much heavier and harder to turn than the typical plastic ones. Yes it's cute and not plastic, but that is sort of it. I'll be selling it online in my moms group shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great for cruising and walking babies
customer_reviews.text: My son loooooves this push walker!!! Definitely his favorite thing to play with. The only CON is that it is really tricky for new walkers to back up and turn, so you end up having to move it for them to set them back on course.
customer_reviews.author: Nate & Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Although I thought a "noiseless" toy would be nice, we now wish the chomping alligators made a ...
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were helpful in selecting this model. It has a very solid construction, is well-balanced to avoid tipping over and very colorful. Just wish it was a bit higher as my grandson is tall for his age and it took him a while to use it as a walker. Although I thought a "noiseless" toy would be nice, we now wish the chomping alligators made a "clickety-clack" noise! Still a good purchase for the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This one is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Chomp and Clack toy I have purchased; keep having grandchildren. It is of good quality and easy to assemble. It is such a fun toy for the new walkers and almost walkers to have and they enjoy it long after. Very well made and it stays together, unlike another brand I purchased that had to be thrown away due to falling apart constantly and creating a hazard. This one is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Marcibeau

customer_reviews.title: Well made and cute walker. It has some weight ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made and cute walker. It has some weight to it so it doesn't slip right out from underneath my son as he lifts himself up and cruises with it (although it would tip over if he threw all of his weight into it - I actually think this is okay for now because it's teaching him some balance too). I wouldn't let him play with this unattended though.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I'm kinda indifferent about what to write about this particular piece. My little man LOVES playing with it, and it's very manageable. Unlike other walkers that I've seen at other stores, this piece doesn't have smaller pieces that could get lost or broken. It's very sturdy and one piece. The only issue that I have with it is that the wheels are hard to turn on certain carpets. Obviously, if you have shag carpets in your home, this won't work at all. It will just get stuck and your little one won't be able to use it. From what I can tell, short carpets, hardwoods and tile floors are best for this.
customer_reviews.author: Nessa Wilson

customer_reviews.title: A fun teaching tool/toy
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this thing. We got him to start playing with it around 10 months old or so and it really helped with teaching him to walk. He would push it across the whole length of the house squealing with joy until he ran into a wall and then would call for us to come turn him around so he could push it back the other way. When play dates come over they love this push toy as well. The chomping alligators make it interesting for the baby.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Showalter

customer_reviews.title: Love Melissa and Doug, and love this toy!
customer_reviews.text: I really love anything from Melissa and Doug: their toys are so thoughtful and cute! We got this for our little guy, who is cruising around the furniture but not yet walking on his own. He loves it, and also plays with the alligators alone, as well as the wooden blocks in the back. Best of all (for me), it's not obnoxiously loud, but the clacking of the alligators keeps his attention. Definitely recommend this toy.
customer_reviews.author: JG17

customer_reviews.title: Product already used
customer_reviews.text: We have received a used product with a lot of dirt on the wheels and at the cart (see pictures). There was also a scratch at the side and the paint peeled from some sites (overall painting seems poorly made). Cannot comment on the functionality of the product because we return it for this obvious reason.
customer_reviews.author: Maja Kekus

customer_reviews.title: Such a great gift!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 10 month old nephew who is about to start walking. It was a hit all Christmas morning! Luckily you don’t hear the crocodiles snapping. I was worried about that.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: The walker easily flips when baby tries to hold it and stand. Wouldn’t recommend this to anyone. Should have read the reviews before buying.
customer_reviews.author: KASHP

customer_reviews.title: Age really does go full circle
customer_reviews.text: We had a little trouble getting both bolts in during assembly as the second hole did not line up. Flipping the handle around and rather forcing the bolt in worked, but I was disappointed that wasn't checked during quality control. Overall it does seem well made, as expected of Melissa & Doug items, and our 9 month old is already very interested in it. Looking forward to watching him really use it as he gets closer to cruising and walking.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall great toy, but no chomping
customer_reviews.text: Great toy, great service, wish that it clacked when the crocodiles close there mouths as he pushes it. Previous versions do clack. His cousin has one and our baby adores it, but our chomp walker is soundless, which I guess is fine, but our little one just giggles up a storm when using the other version and not ours. Not a deal breaker, but a small bummer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift.
customer_reviews.text: This clacker has felt padding, so low noise. My 12 mo. old granddaughter loves it as well as her 4 yr old sister. Was easy to put together in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Thora Goodnight

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but loud
customer_reviews.text: So cute! I bought when my little boy was turning 1 because we wanted to encourage him to walk. When he was first learning the alligators on this weren't annoying because he walked so slow. Now that he's 2 he still loves to push this around but because he can run with it now the alligators are so loud when they clack! It's super cute and is really sturdy (it definitely won't fall to the side or backwards when your little one is using it) but it's just noisy. I'd probably still buy it again though.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brady

customer_reviews.title: Melissa and Doug Chomp and Clack Alligator
customer_reviews.text: We have bought the Chomp and Clack Alligator walker for two sets of grandchildren. The boys love it, and it has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Wood broke with gentle use.
customer_reviews.text: First one came poorly painted so I returned. Second one a piece of wood broke off while my 8 month old was getly playing with it, glad my husband was with her when the wood cracked. It also does not hold her weight for her to pull herself up, she is 19 lb. It topples over ever time.
customer_reviews.author: Heyitsme

customer_reviews.title: we love this walker!
customer_reviews.text: This walker is awesome! It’s really cute, good quality and very sturdy. It’s helped our son learn to pull himself up and walk. Easy to assemble and keep clean. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Coates

customer_reviews.title: It's sturdy and has lasted through quite an abuse
customer_reviews.text: Our baby loves this push toy! It's sturdy and has lasted through quite an abuse. The crocodiles chomp down as the kid pushes it around and it's quite entertaining for the little ones. Our kid used it religiously when learning to walk and still finds it amusing to run and push it around. The base is quite heavy and I've never seen it topple over even when applying pressure at the handle.
customer_reviews.author: ata0318

customer_reviews.title: Great Heirloom Toy
customer_reviews.text: This is what you call an "heirloom toy". I love giving wooden toys. They are very durable and can be saved for other generations of kids. This one is so cute with it's snapping alligators opening and closing their mouths as the toy is pushed along. This is great for pre-walkers. It helps them to balance and get comfortable with their walking skills. It gets a bit noisy once they learn to run with it over a tiled indoor floor!
customer_reviews.author: Connie Woods

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and works great on wooden floor
customer_reviews.text: This toy worked great for helping our child learn to walk. The plastic toy we initially tried did not provide enough resistance on a wooden floor. The weight of the toy and the soft rings around the wheels were just right on our wooden floor.
customer_reviews.author: B. Berg

product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug Chomp & Clack Alligator Push Toy
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThree alligators will charm toddlers as they take turns chomping with every step! This multisensory wooden push toy encourages walking and discovery. Graphic details include cattails on the handle supports, fish on the wheels, and spinning butterfly and ladybug beads. This cheerful toy encourages gross and fine motor skills while developing hand-eye coordination. It’s brightly painted with child-safe paint. The Chomp & Clack Alligator Push Toy is designed to help children 12 months and older develop and improve agility and balance, and to create a fun opportunity for exercise. The handle is easy to grab and hold, so your little one can steer the push toy in straight lines or along wandering paths. Non-skid wheels let your child walk along smooth surfaces without moving too fast or leaving unsightly marks on your floor. The Alligator Push Toy is a delightful gift for kids 12 months and up. Add the Melissa & Doug First Play Wooden Elephant Rocking Stacker to round out the hands-on play experience and give kids an engaging option for screen-free fun. For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.” Today, Melissa & Doug is proudly partnering with the American Academy of Pediatrics to foster early brain development and help children build important life skills through play.

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From classic wooden toys to crafts, pretend play, and games, Melissa & Doug products provide a launch pad to ignite imagination and a sense of wonder in all children so they can discover themselves, their passions, and their purpose. 

Since the company’s founding more than 25 years ago, Melissa & Doug has consistently delivered innovative products that inspire open-ended thinking, encourage kids to see new possibilities, and offer Countless Ways to Play. It’s part of a bigger vision to Take Back Childhood. Because by giving children a true childhood with the space and freedom to explore their world, we give them a path to realizing their full potential!

See more
feature_bullets: WOODEN WALKER WITH ENGAGING ACTIVITIES: The Melissa & Doug Chomp & Clack Alligator Push Toy is a wooden activity walker for babies on the move. It features three chomping alligators, fish on the wheels, and spinning butterfly and ladybug beads.

STURDY CONSTRUCTION AND CRAFTSMANSHIP: Our alligator push toy is made with high- quality materials and assembled to precision manufacturing standards. This keeps it safe for children 12 months and older to use.
MAKES SOUNDS WHEN MOVED: This child push toy makes a gentle clacking noise when it is pushed. This cheerful toy encourages gross and fine motor skills while developing hand-eye coordination.

GIFT FOR 12 MONTHS AND UP: This toy is a great gift for kids 12 months and up. Add the Melissa & Doug First Play Wooden Elephant Rocking Stacker to round out the hands-on play experience and give kids an engaging option for screen-free fun.

“THE GOLD STANDARD IN CHILDHOOD PLAY”: For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.”

100% HAPPINESS GUARANTEE: We design every toy to the highest quality standards, and to nurture minds and hearts. If your child is not inspired, give us a call and we'll make it right. Our phone number is on every product!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,285 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
